This should ensure  that the following stylesheet processing instruction is honored by  these new browser versions. For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Spanish, Portuguese and Latin American Studies</title>   <subtitle>The Department of Spanish, Portuguese and Latin American Studies is one of the leading centres of its kind in the UK. Awarded the highest possible score for the quality of its teaching in the latest independent review at subject level, the Department offers a wide range of degree courses that include the two most-spoken Romance languages in the world.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-12T19:33:49Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Portuguese and International Media and Communications Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/culture,filmandmedia/portuguese-international-media-communications.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Helen Frost</name>     </author>     <summary>On this course you normally divide your time equally between both subjects. In Portuguese, you study the Portuguese language and the history, culture, cinema and literature of the Lusophone (Portuguese-speaking) world. In communications studies, you examine the theory and history of media and communications in a global context.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:41:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-26T12:29:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/culture,filmandmedia/portuguese-international-media-communications.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Languages BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modernlanguagesba.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Modern Languages at The University of Nottingham are part of the School of Cultures, Languages and Area Studies (CLAS). Studying a modern language involves much more than just learning to speak the language.You will gain expertise in national and regional cultures and cover themes such as film, history, linguistics, literature, media and politics, amongst others.</summary>     <published>2014-06-10T15:45:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T16:22:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modernlanguagesba.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics with Hispanic Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-hispanic.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The aim of these degrees is to produce high-quality economic analysts who are fluent in a language, rather than linguists with some training in economics. As a result, you will study the same core economics modules as those taking BA (Hons) Economics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-07T15:44:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-hispanic.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>English and Hispanic Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/english-hispanic.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>On this course you will study Spanish language and aspects of the histories, cultures, cinemas and literatures of Spain and Spanish America. You have the option to continue with Portuguese language beyond the first year and to study aspects of the histories and cultures of the Portuguese-speaking world, including Portugal, Brazil and Lusophone Africa.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:58:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T12:44:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/english-hispanic.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Languages with Translation BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-languages-with-translation.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Information on Modern Languages with Translation BA</summary>     <published>2013-08-15T16:30:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-26T13:44:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-languages-with-translation.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Hispanic Studies and History BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/hispanic-history.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>On this course you will study Spanish and aspects of the history, culture, cinema and literature of Spain and Spanish America. You will also have the possibility of continuing with Portuguese language beyond your first year and studying aspects of the histories, cultures and literatures of the Lusophone (Portuguese-speaking) world, including Portugal, Brazil and Lusophone Africa.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:55:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T13:07:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/hispanic-history.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Hispanic Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/hispanic.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Susie Colley</name>     </author>     <summary>On this course you will study the Spanish and Portuguese languages and aspects of the histories, cultures, cinemas and literatures of the Portuguese and Spanish-speaking worlds. Most students opt to study Portuguese throughout the degree, but it is possible to concentrate exclusively on Spanish after the second year.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:54:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-25T11:38:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/hispanic.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Law with Spanish and Spanish Law BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/law/law-spanish.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rebecca Weaver</name>     </author>     <summary>This course is designed to equip students with a legal qualification based on English law and to encourage an appreciation of European law and Spanish law, allied to linguistic competence, and cultural awareness of the country.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:03:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-10T11:45:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/law/law-spanish.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Management with Spanish BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/business/management-spanish.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Paul Gelsthorpe</name>     </author>     <summary>Covering the same core areas as BSc Management, this course also offers you the opportunity to perfect your command of Spanish. You will study a wide range of business and management modules, along with the Spanish language and related subjects, such as Spanish media, literature and politics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:57:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-08-19T13:06:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/business/management-spanish.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern European Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-european.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rachel Bainbridge</name>     </author>     <summary>Modern European Studies is available in three different branches: modern history and two modern languages; politics and two modern languages; or modern history, politics and one modern language.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:53:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-12T11:03:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-european.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Language Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-language.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rachel Bainbridge</name>     </author>     <summary>This course enables you to study three languages; you can choose three from post-A level French, German, Russian or Spanish, or two from those above along with beginners' modules in either Russian, German, Serbian/Croatian, Portuguese, Slovene, Spanish or Dutch.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:53:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-11T16:17:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-language.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Languages with Business BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-languages-business.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>This course enables you to combine the study of two European languages to final degree level with a range of nonlinguistic modules and business modules.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:53:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-03T15:21:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-languages-business.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Spanish and Contemporary Chinese Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/spanish-contemporary-chinese.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This course offers you the opportunity to combine studies in Spanish and Chinese languages, literatures, histories and cultures. The year abroad gives you a unique opportunity to practise your language skills and enhance your understanding of the Spanish and Chinese cultures.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:55:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-03T14:45:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/spanish,portugueseandlatinamericanstudies/spanish-contemporary-chinese.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Spanish and International Media and Communications Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/culture,filmandmedia/spanish-international-media-communications.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>On these courses you normally divide your time equally between both subjects. In Spanish you study the Spanish language and the history, culture, cinema and literature of the Spanish-speaking world.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:36:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T11:40:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/culture,filmandmedia/spanish-international-media-communications.aspx</id>   </entry> </feed>
